## Discussion

`UIGraphicsImageDrawingActions` defines a block type that takes a [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIGraphicsImageRendererContext] object as an argument and has no return value.

You provide a block of this type as an argument to the image drawing methods on [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIGraphicsImageRenderer]. Your block should use the provided image renderer context to perform the drawing operations you want the renderer to execute.

See [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIGraphicsImageRenderer#Creating-an-image-with-an-image-renderer] for an example use of a `UIGraphicsImageDrawingActions` block.

# UIGraphicsImageRenderer.DrawingActions

**Type Alias**

A closure for drawing an image.

## Declaration

```swift
typealias DrawingActions = (UIGraphicsImageRendererContext) -> Void
```

## Discussion

`UIGraphicsImageDrawingActions` defines a block type that takes a [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIGraphicsImageRendererContext] object as an argument and has no return value.

You provide a block of this type as an argument to the image drawing methods on [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIGraphicsImageRenderer]. Your block should use the provided image renderer context to perform the drawing operations you want the renderer to execute.

See [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIGraphicsImageRenderer#Creating-an-image-with-an-image-renderer] for an example use of a `UIGraphicsImageDrawingActions` block.

## Creating images

- **image(actions:)**: Creates an image from a set of drawing instructions.
- **jpegData(withCompressionQuality:actions:)**: Creates a JPEG-encoded image from a set of drawing instructions.
- **pngData(actions:)**: Creates a PNG-encoded image from a set of drawing instructions.
